body:
let's say start is a very, very small number (-1000000). Then start would be out of bounds after this line and we wouldn't be able to report the error here to the user.

You should try to call `maybe_wrap_dim` [(usage here)](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/64834f6fb8055cf2d633353992288a8823b915ed/aten/src/ATen/native/TensorShape.cpp#L52) instead
body_html:
let's say start is a very, very small number (-1000000). Then start would be out of bounds after this line and we wouldn't be able to report the error here to the user.

You should try to call maybe_wrap_dim (usage here) instead
body_text:
let's say start is a very, very small number (-1000000). Then start would be out of bounds after this line and we wouldn't be able to report the error here to the user.
You should try to call maybe_wrap_dim (usage here) instead
